Description: Head or mask bead. A fantastic or imaginary face in dark-blue glass, matt surface. The eyes are in the form of circles made of pale-yellow threads. From the nose, which is broken, two pale-yellow threads flare up over the eyes terminating in flat loops as ears. The base of the face is outlined in pale yellow. Suspension loop in dark-blue glass on top of head. The vertical opening retains a tan core. Poor work.
Bibliographic references: Glass / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Glass in the British Museum (393)
